author: Remi
title: Palancar Reef
content:
Today was unreal. I dove off the coast of Cozumel and finally saw the famous Palancar Reef with my own eyes. The water was so clear it felt like flying. I floated weightlessly through tunnels of coral, surrounded by schools of neon fish that shimmered like living confetti. A curious sea turtle swam alongside me for a few seconds—long enough to make me feel like I was part of its world.

We reached about 60 feet, and for a moment, everything went silent except for the sound of my breath. It was oddly calming. I saw a spotted eagle ray gliding gracefully in the distance—so effortless, like it was dancing.

Back on the boat, I couldn’t stop smiling. Salt still clung to my skin, and my hair was a mess, but I felt completely alive. Mexico’s reefs are magic. Can’t wait to go back down tomorrow.
